content: on ws rrrroooowwww 2222 ws p2 *k1 p2 repeat from * 2 cid 1  cid 1   cid 1  cid 1   yo rrrroooowwww 3333 rs *k2 p1 k2tog yo p1 repeat cid 1  cid 1   cid 1  cid 1  1 k2tog from * to last 2 sts k2 ssk rrrroooowwww 4444 ws repeat row 2 pattern repeat directions beginning see pattern notes #4 using any moderately elastic co method co 44 sts project shown uses long tail co method work set-up row ws *p2 k1 repeat from * to last 2 sts p2 scarf see pattern notes #5 & 6 work row 1-4 of frostlight st patt until scarf is 70 / 178 cm long or to desired length ending with row 4 ws finishing bobble all sts use tapestry needle to weave in ends block lightly to measurements if you desire a deep ribbing this scarf benefits from a light blocking stretching for a lacier look during blocking may result in loss of textural depth and elasticity optional fringes see pattern notes #7 cut 48 strands of yarn each 14 / 36 cm long by wrapping yarn around a 7 / 18 cm piece of stiff cardboard and cutting once along edge divide into 16 sets of 3 strands fold each 3-strand set in half to form a loop 16 fringes made evenly space 8 fringes along each end of scarf rs facing reach crochet hook up through scarf edge and pull fringe loop down through scarf use crochet hook to pull fringe ends down through loop and secure trim fringe ends if desired keep up with the latest at robin ulrich studio robinulrich blogspot com twitter robinulrich ravelry truknit all contents copyright robin ulrich studio 2014 all rights reserved this pattern is for private use only and may not be reproduced in any way or re-posted online without permission of the designer this pattern may not be used to produce items for commercial purposes for inquiries about robin ulrich studio patterns please contact robinulrichstudio@live com frostlight © robin ulrich studio 2014 robinulrich blogspot com
